{{also|Kurz}} ==Czech== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|cs|kurs}} ===Etymology=== {{der|cs|la|curro}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{cs-IPA}} * {{audio|cs|Cs-kurz.ogg|audio}} ===Noun=== {{cs-noun|g=m}} # [[course]] {{gloss|period of learning}} # [[course]] {{gloss|direction of movement of a vessel}} # [[rate]] {{gloss|in exchange rate}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|cs|měnový kurz}} * {{l|cs|kurzovné}} * {{l|cs|kurzovní}} ===Related terms=== {{rel-top}} * {{l|cs|diskurz}} * {{l|cs|exkurz}} * {{l|cs|exkurze}} * {{l|cs|konkurence}} * {{l|cs|konkurent}} * {{l|cs|konkurovat}} * {{l|cs|konkurz}} * {{l|cs|korzár}} * {{l|cs|korzo}} * {{l|cs|kurentní}} * {{l|cs|kurikulum}} * {{l|cs|kurýr}} * {{l|cs|kurziva}} * {{l|cs|kurzivní}} * {{l|cs|kurzor}} * {{l|cs|prekurzor}} * {{l|cs|rekurence}} * {{l|cs|rekurentní}} * {{l|cs|rekurovat}} * {{l|cs|rekurze}} * {{l|cs|rekurzivita}} * {{l|cs|rekurzivní}} {{rel-bottom}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:ASCS}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|kurz}}, from {{inh|de|goh|kurz}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*kurtaz}}, from {{der|de|la|curtus}}. Compare also native {{noncog|goh|*skurz}}, {{m|goh|scurz}} and {{noncog|gmh|schurz}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|curt}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/kʊʁt͡s/|[kʰʊɐ̯t͡s]}} * {{audio|de|De-kurz.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-kurz.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Adjective=== {{de-adj|kürzer|kürzesten}} # [[short]], [[brief]] # [[concise]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-adj|kurz|kürzer|kürzest}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[briefly]], [[in short]] ====Derived terms==== {{der4|de|kurz vor|kurzab|Kürze|kürzen|kurzfristig|kürzlich|Kurzmitteilung|verkürzen|Kurzschrift|Kurzschluss|kurzkettig|[[megakurz]], [[superkurz]], [[ultrakurz]]|Kurzzeichen|Kurzstrecke|Vokuhila}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Old High German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|goh|churt}}, {{l|goh|churz}}, {{l|goh|kurt}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|goh|gem-pro|*kurtaz}}, a very late borrowing from {{bor|goh|la|curtus}}, therefore forms with and without shift of ''-t-''. Compare a similar situation in {{m+|de|Pforte}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|goh|/kurt͡s/}} ===Adjective=== {{goh-adj}} # [[short]] ====Derived terms==== * {{l|goh|kurzī}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|gmh|kurz}}, {{l|gmh|korz}}, {{l|gmh|kurt}} ** {{desc|gmw-cfr|kurt|alts=1}} ** {{desc|de|kurz}} ** {{desc|lb|kuerz}} ** {{desc|yi|קורץ}} ---- ==Polish== ===Etymology=== Deverbal of {{m|pl|kurzyć}}. Compare {{cog|cs|kouř}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{pl-IPA}} * {{audio|pl|Pl-kurz.ogg|audio}} * {{homophones|pl|kusz}} ===Noun=== {{pl-noun|m-in}} # [[dust]] ====Usage notes==== There are two words that overlap semantically with English {{m|en|dust}}. The first one is {{m|pl|kurz}}, which refers to airborne dust that settles on things as a form of [[pollution]]. The second is {{m|pl|pył}}, which is neutral and refers to any very finely divided solid substance. For instance, the phrase ''I swiped the '''dust''' from the shelves'' would be equivalent to ''Starłem '''kurz''' z półek'', but the compound ''coal '''dust''''' would be translated as '''''pył''' węglowy''. ====Declension==== {{pl-decl-noun-masc-inani|ku|rz|u|genp=kurzów}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|pl|kurzyć}} * {{l|pl|zakurzony}} ===Verb=== {{head|pl|verb form}} # {{inflection of|pl|kurzyć||2|s|impr}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:pl:WSJP}} * {{R:PWN}}
